verses.kjv: Then answered Bildad the Shuhite, and said,
verses.ct: Then Bildad the Shuhite responded:

verses.kjv: How long wilt thou speak these things? and how long shall the words of thy mouth be like a strong wind?
verses.ct: "How much longer will you go on like this? Your words are nothing but a blast of hot air.

verses.kjv: Doth God pervert judgment? or doth the Almighty pervert justice?
verses.ct: Does God twist what is right? Does the Almighty distort justice?

verses.kjv: If thy children have sinned against him, and he have cast them away for their transgression;
verses.ct: If your children sinned against him, he handed them over to the consequences of their rebellion.

verses.kjv: If thou wouldest seek unto God betimes, and make thy supplication to the Almighty;
verses.ct: But if you would earnestly turn to God and plead with the Almighty,

verses.kjv: If thou wert pure and upright; surely now he would awake for thee, and make the habitation of thy righteousness prosperous.
verses.ct: if you were truly pure and honest, then surely he would rise up on your behalf and restore your righteous home to prosperity.

verses.kjv: Though thy beginning was small, yet thy latter end should greatly increase.
verses.ct: Even if your beginnings were humble, your future would be incredibly abundant.

verses.kjv: For enquire, I pray thee, of the former age, and prepare thyself to the search of their fathers:
verses.ct: Please, ask the previous generation and pay attention to what their ancestors discovered.

verses.kjv: (For we are but of yesterday, and know nothing, because our days upon earth are a shadow:)
verses.ct: (After all, we were only born yesterday and understand nothing — our time on earth passes like a shadow.)

verses.kjv: Shall not they teach thee, and tell thee, and utter words out of their heart?
verses.ct: Won't they instruct you and share with you, speaking wisdom from their experience?

verses.kjv: Can the rush grow up without mire? can the flag grow without water?
verses.ct: Can papyrus grow tall without a marsh? Can reeds thrive without water?

verses.kjv: Whilst it is yet in his greenness, and not cut down, it withereth before any other herb.
verses.ct: While still green and not yet harvested, they dry up faster than any other plant.

verses.kjv: So are the paths of all that forget God; and the hypocrite’s hope shall perish:
verses.ct: That is what happens to everyone who forgets God; the hope of the godless will die.

verses.kjv: Whose hope shall be cut off, and whose trust shall be a spider’s web.
verses.ct: Their confidence will be snapped off, and what they trust in is as flimsy as a spider's web.

verses.kjv: He shall lean upon his house, but it shall not stand: he shall hold it fast, but it shall not endure.
verses.ct: They lean on their house, but it collapses; they grab hold of it, but it falls apart.

verses.kjv: He is green before the sun, and his branch shooteth forth in his garden.
verses.ct: They are like a well-watered plant flourishing in the sunshine, spreading its branches across the garden.

verses.kjv: His roots are wrapped about the heap, and seeth the place of stones.
verses.ct: Its roots wrap around a pile of stones and push through the rocky ground.

verses.kjv: If he destroy him from his place, then it shall deny him, saying, I have not seen thee.
verses.ct: But when it is ripped from its spot, that place disowns it, saying, 'I never knew you.'

verses.kjv: Behold, this is the joy of his way, and out of the earth shall others grow.
verses.ct: Look — that is all the joy its life amounts to, and from the same soil, other plants spring up to replace it.

verses.kjv: Behold, God will not cast away a perfect man, neither will he help the evil doers:
verses.ct: Listen — God does not reject a person of integrity, and he will not support those who do evil.

verses.kjv: Till he fill thy mouth with laughing, and thy lips with rejoicing.
verses.ct: He will yet fill your mouth with laughter and your lips with shouts of joy.

verses.kjv: They that hate thee shall be clothed with shame; and the dwelling place of the wicked shall come to nought.
verses.ct: Those who hate you will be covered in disgrace, and the homes of the wicked will be reduced to nothing."
